reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in promptly, room not ready. then when we did book in it was a rush job - we were given a lovely room with a great view, we were in this room for ten minutes then we had to move to a pokey room at the back. We were not able to discuss our booking at reception as we were rushed, because of a misunderstanding with the terminology on the website booking form we did not take breakfast thinking it was not included, on checkout we found it had been included ands we missed it! This hotel is extremely expensive if you get a pokey room at the back and no breakfast. Position of hotel first class for sight seeing bus service/metro, funicular, castle - relaxing however when we were there the beach cable car was not working and this was one of the reasons for choosing this hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced Overhyped

likes.liked: — proximity to public transport yet away from the centre of Barcelona
likes.disliked: — Dismissive attitude of recepion staff the rush to move us on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this gorgeous hotel for 5 nights recently, as soon as we walked into the modern reception we knew we`d made the right choice. We were dealt with by the reception staff in speedy time and were shown to our room. As soon as the door was opened we were wowed with a lovely speacious room, huge bathroom with a walk in shower and v deep bath tub.Decor was neutral with dark wood furniture. The balcony had comfortable table and chairs and had one of the best views we`ve ever experienced over looking the city!
reviews.title: A fab long weekend away!

likes.liked: — The relaxed feeling after a hectic day in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend doing the city tour bus, the stop is just left of the hotel, at 20 euros each for one day it was a little pricey but we felt it would be the only way you could see the sights of Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very disappointed
a tranquil oasis
reviews.text: We would also recommend the Miramar restaurant which is near the stairs down to the city, we had an excellent meal there on our first night, views of the city were stunning and food was one of the best we`ve had from around the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As the weather was so hot whilst on our trip we spent two days around the pool, where we received fresh towels and comfy sun loungers. The pool bar serves excellent snacks and drinks even if a little expensive buy hey you`re on your hols!
reviews.title: Best Place for Chilling after a day in Barcelona

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping service was a bit over-enthusiastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a top contender to my all-time favs.
reviews.title: WOW !!! Amazing
Nice hotel but a long way from the centre
reviews.text: Located on Montjuc the Olympic mountain and overlooking the harbour this is a gem of a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a huge terrace overlooking the harbour.
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an experience this is. Great stylish hotel, You are in the barri gothic in 5-10 minutes by cab and 20 minutes via foot. You can take the cable car to go directly to Barcelonetta beach or you can just bask all day by the sunny pool and relax.
reviews.title: Pure Sophistication

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you go to Barca, this is the one. It might not be as happening as the OMM or as chique as the Arts, but if u are after a great hotel with good value for money and an awesome view make this the hotel of your choice.
reviews.title: First time in Barcelona and couldn't have stayed anywhere better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4-9 July 2009, superior room #502
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - horrible service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a wonderful setting with a beautiful view of Barcelona and the sea! The décor is magnificent; modern and tasteful with warm colors. Our room was large and modern, tastefully decorated and comfortable with a big terrace overlooking Barcelona and the sea. Bathroom was huge with center bathtub and separate shower. The pool area is great with comfy sun loungers, BUT too few chairs which is very strange since there is plenty of space. The gym was very good with modern equipment. So PHYSICALLY this hotel has all the parameters to be a 5 star luxury hotel, however it fails completely on its poor service and their lack of interest for their guests!!
reviews.title: A different opinion about the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had booked a romantic package through SLH which included buffet breakfast, “candle lit” dinner for two, special bubble bath, bottle of Cava and strawberries with chocolate in the room upon arrival and a welcome drink on arrival.
reviews.title: Unscrupulous hotel that has gone to customer service ruin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No welcome drink was offered. Nor was there any Cava or strawberries in the room (but was brought up to us later when we asked the reception). When we arrived we requested dinner reservation on the terrace at 10.00 but was told only available time was a 9.00. As we thought it was a busy evening we accepted it but was astonished to see an empty restaurant when we arrived. We didn’t even get a table on the terrace since they claimed it was already fully booked (which we were not told about earlier). Interior of restaurant pretty dull so we had to re-scheduled the dinner for another evening with a guaranteed terrace table. Miramar is not quite in the centre of town and there are no nearby restaurants, so we ended up having our dinner in the hotel bar (which wasn’t an overwhelming experience). The “special” bath in our package was never presented during our stay. Package also included free soft drinks in room mini bar and on arrival we requested it to replenish with water, which never happed despite the promise.
reviews.title: I suggest you read this before staying at the Miramar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We sent an email to the GM explaining about all these issues and asked why the hotel offered the package when they were unable (unwilling?) to deliver? We never got a reply.
reviews.title: excellent by all means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Miramar and loved it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel Miramar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the hotel is not in the main city we decided to split our trip between two hotels: Hotel Omm by Passig de Gracia and Hotel Miramar in Montjuic. This was a perfect choice for us as we had the chance to explore the city while within it for the first part of the trip and then see the city from the hills at Miramar. While at Miramar we took a walk to the Montjuic castle, visited the National Museum, rode the cable car from Port Vell directly to the hotel!
reviews.title: Great location but inconsistent service and poor internal communication between staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has the most amazing pool that is open all night for a late night swim. The views from this hotel should not be missed. I found the staff to be extremely wonderful and helpful. They arranged for taxis, wake-up calls and provided the codes for free wireless internet. Our mini bar was restocked daily and our requests fro more soda and water was met. We had the romantic barcelona package and they provided everything as described.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in park setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Miramar is a wonderful place and I would recommend that this hotel supplement your stay after a few nights in a hotel located in the city.
reviews.title: Quiet and secluded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent a long weekend in the Miramar in late June 2009. Our room (321) was spacious and clean however did not have a jacuzzi on the balcony (although the hotel description implies all rooms have one). The glass door in the bathroom opened outwards and is a definite health risk esp. if responding to a call of nature at night!!!! The outdoor pool is nice - however watch out for broken glass in the grass!! We experienced the now well documented problems in having the minibar restocked and our several requests to reception did not materialise through housekeeping. We enjoyed a nice lunch, however dinner was very dissappointing (e.g. starter was three lukewarm prawns swimming in a sea of cold blitzed avocado!!!), and the quality of service was very poor. When travelling from the hotel you can take either the "PM" or "50" bus from near the roundabout left of the main entrance road into Place Espanya where you can buy an integrated travel card in the metro station which is great value. Alternatively walk up the hill towards the Olympic stadium and take the funicular railway to the metro at Parral lel (you can buy a travel card in the funicular station). Great views from the hotel and be sure to take a trip on the cable car just around the corner from the hotel. When booking a taxi at reception make sure to remind / double check as they seem to forget!! (staff were very polite however seemed not to follow through requests which can be frustrating).
reviews.title: The Miramar - Simply Magnificent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely and the location and gardens outside fantastic. We didn't find the steep hill a problem and we had a toddler with us. The proximity to Barcelona means that views from the balconies (if you get one) are fabulous.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately service really let the hotel down. We arrived and were put in a small room with no balcony even though we'd paid €320 a night. We eventually moved 2 days later and the room we got was twice the size, had a hot tub, etc. We feel we didn't get what we'd paid for. The hotel says they provide bottle warmers for babies; it doesn't. So instead of reception making the effort to help, we were told to go to the restaurant ourselves to get it warmed. We asked for the mini bar to be re-stocked (the soft drinks are free) and it took them all day to do it. Some days they didn't even bother re-filling it. Some days they turned down the bed and some days they didn't. Towels were never refreshed at the pool, you had to help yourself. Sometimes the pool bar was shut for no reason.
reviews.title: modern luxus in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst these issues might seem trivial, when you are paying £300 (excluding breakfast) a night and the hotel is a member of small luxury hotels of the world, you expect service to be immaculate and at the very least helpful.
reviews.title: City hotel without the city hassle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOWEVER, due to the location and the fact the rooms and grounds are so nice we WOULD go back, but we would ensure that we specifically request a balcony!
reviews.title: Great modern hotel in beautiful setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Really confortable 5 star hotel two steps from dowtown (6€ by taxi, 10 minutes walk from Metro Paral El). Big confortable rooms with terrasse with view on the Marina and/or the city. Small details like free soft drinks and beer in the mini bar. Really nice breakfast and helpfull personnal. with one outdoor pool on a really nice clam garden, one inside spa/sport area
reviews.title: Great Location, Beautiful Facility; Execution Needs Work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (husband & 16 year old daughter) stayed at this beautiful hotel for 6 nights. The location is a little out of the center--up on Montjouic hill. It is a 2 minute walk to the subway which gets you into the core (Plaza Catalunya) in 15-20mins. The walk into the city is on a dirt path that is littered with broken bottles and some homeless people camping out, but if you venture that way, you'll get to Las Ramblas in 15 minutes. You generally have to call for a taxi as it is quite secluded, and it takes a bit of time for one to arrive. The staff are all VERY YOUNG--no one seemed beyond late 20's or early 30's which would have been fine, BUT they were not knowledgeable about restaurant recommendations or about events happening in the city. There is no concierge to help you with requests of any sort. Aside from that, the rooms were very nice, modern and large. Ours had a small balcony and great view of the Mediterranean, although the room did smell a little musty. Our daughter's room was a little more expensive, but larger, with a huge balcony without a view. The pools are gorgeous as is the area around the outdoor pool. There is one computer in the "business centre" but it is not often available. Thus overall very nice, but not 5 star when it came to services. The price is definitely right!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, NO CONCIERGE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: That was a great experience for Catalunya. The hotel was comfortable, staff were friendly. I recommend this hotel for happy hours:)
reviews.title: Bounas Noches" :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: So, we stayed at the Hotel Miramar Barcelona after a cruise. We had already seen most of Barcelona before the boat, so we were looking for a relaxing way to spend our last days in Barcelona. It is situated on a hill, not far from Las Ramblas and the Marina. It is easily accessible to anywhere in the center of town, the beach taxi cost only 5 Euro...Upon arrival...I could not believe what a beautiful hotel this was. EVERYTHING was done to perfection. I felt like we were in complete modern luxury. The pools are fabulous (indoor and outdoor), spa is fabulous, views are incredible, every inch of this property is manicured to perfection. I chose to pay for the visit ahead of time, and it made the suite rate really reasonable. The room was INCREDIBLE. The bathrooms were absolutely luxurious, the terrace was to die for, we even had a really nice hot tub on our terrace, overlooking the sea. They even set out terrycloth robes for our kids (in correct sizes because they asked before hand.) A complementary mini bar was stocked each day...the food at the hotel pool bar was reasonable and very good. The breakfast (25 Euro) was worth every cent. It was a magic experience for our entire family.
reviews.title: Dreamlike!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortuntely we arrived the hotel at 10 pm and had to leave at 7 am the following morning. we wish we could have stayed longer because the hotel was so beuatiful and we would have enjoyed relaxing by the gorgeous pool or getting a spa treatment. The staff were excellent and friendly. The room was quite large, modern and clean with a outdoor patio. Many of the rooms looked to have balconies that overlooked the city and/or ocean. The landscaping was immaculate with a wonderfully designed pool and outdoor lounging area. The outdoor dining areas had magnificent views over the ocean. The only issue is location. You'll have to take a cab to get into the heart of the city but if you are interested in just relaxing with the ocassional trip into the city, this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff and immaculate grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Miramar was a lovely hotel - one of the best I've stayed at in Europe. My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of July. I tried not to get my hopes up having read previous reviews but I have to say that on arrival I was really impressed with the hotel. The lobby is nice and modern and the room (classic room 303) was very large, with a separate room with toilet and bidet, separate bathroom with walk in rainwater shower and stand alone bath and then the bedroom/living room which was very spacious and a terrace with space for two chairs and a table and two sun loungers. We were convinced we must have been upgraded, but I don't think we had! We were at the back of the hotel so had no view, but that wasn't a problem for us at all.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - beautiful setting and spacious rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The AC Miramar has been completely renewed about two years ago. My room was very large with big windows, overlooking the harbour. It had fantastic features, such as a flat screen TV, a very spacious marble shower with water coming down like the Niagara Falls, a designer bathtube in the room, screened by a semi-transparent curtain - and an unbelievable comfortable bed. I never slept so well anywhere! Everything was extremely clean.
reviews.title: AC Miramar Barcelona -fantastic rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personnel of the reception were very helpful, the waiters professional, but for my taste the food was not up to the standard of the Hotel. The microphones in the meeting room did not fuction well.
reviews.title: Great room with hugh balcony!

likes.liked: — The spacious room and high quality furniture
likes.disliked: — the toilet door, was not very private

reviews.title: Loved the tranquility
reviews.text: Unfortunately I had not the time to use the well-equipped Wellness-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Centre. Maybe the next time.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was given a lovely, spacious room with a wide terrace that included a jacuzzi. The jacuzzi did not work. The water in the room was cut off for over three hours with no notification or progress reports from reception. Then, the shower with its many spray heads leaked into the entry hall. Off I went to another room.
reviews.title: Hotel Miramar in Barcelona... muy bien!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Again, lovely, spacious room with large terrace. Again, no hot water in the early evening and no notification from the reception. The receptionist explained that it was Sunday and there was no maintenance!
reviews.title: AMAZING place to stay... beautiful setting, state-of-the-art rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The "world class" spa is potentially fabulous ... but! No bottled in the refrigerator for bottled water. Soiled towels were strewn about the spa and shower room. Jacuzzi temperature was tepid with mud around the rim. One ha man was cool; the other not working. There was no light in the sauna. There was so much standing water in the halls of the spa that one could easily have fallen. Over a period of four days, there was never an attendant in sight.
reviews.title: Service over and above the norm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: A very nice breakfast is offered at the ridiculous price of 25 €; 12€ for a continental breakfast. Similarly, internet access was offered at 12€ per day. A dial-up telephone connection would have been MUCH faster.
reviews.title: Far from the Madding Crowd

likes.liked: — Utlimate design hotel in peaceful setting
